news.title: Odisha to open ₹500–1,500 monthly rental homes for migrants, students and workers
news.para: Odisha's housing and urban development department is launching a unique rental housing project across urban centers, offering affordable, quality accommodation for students and the urban poor. Rents will range from Rs 500 to Rs 1,500 per month. Several complexes are under construction, with one already operational in Bhubaneswar.

news.title: AURIC Smart City projects to generate 62,405 jobs, ₹71,343 crore investment potential: Government
news.para: AURIC Smart City's Shendra-Bidkin Industrial Area has garnered significant investments, exceeding Rs 82,315 crore, from companies like Ather Energy and Toyota Kirloskar. This development promises to generate over 49,455 direct and indirect jobs. To further support MSMEs, office space rents at AURIC will be reduced by 50% starting April 1, 2025.

news.title: Height curbs to apply in 20km of Noida airport, YEIDA to tweak bylaws
news.para: YEIDA is revising its building bylaws to align with AAI's height restrictions near Noida International Airport. The decision, made official at a board meeting, integrates AAI's Colour-Coded Zoning Map (CCZM) into Building Bylaws-2010. This ensures safe flight paths, requiring NOCs for structures above 15m and impacting residential, commercial, and industrial projects within a 20km radius.

news.title: New building rule may drive sales of independent homes in Chennai
news.para: Tamil Nadu's government now permits stilt plus two-floor buildings up to 10 meters, benefiting families aspiring to own villas and independent homes in Chennai. This change unlocks stilt space for parking, speeds up handovers, and is expected to spark fresh demand for plotted developments. The self-certification scheme simplifies approvals, saving time and costs for builders and customers.

news.title: Flooded streets, empty sites: Gurugram real estate hits a snag
news.para: Gurgaon's infrastructure collapse, exacerbated by heavy monsoon rains and lack of dedicated development, has significantly impacted real estate sales, causing a dip in buyer site visits. Experts suggest Noida may benefit from Gurgaon's woes due to its superior infrastructure. The situation is further compounded by investor speculation and upcoming inauspicious periods, leading to overall sales decline in the NCR.

news.title: Dubai looks to capitalise on weak dirham to lure British home buyers
news.para: UAE developers target British investors due to a weaker dirham. They open London offices amid domestic oversupply concerns. British investment in Dubai homes rose significantly. UK residents became top foreign property buyers. Some experts predict a downturn in Dubai property prices. UAE developers are also launching development arms in the UK. They aim to attract wealthy Emiratis to London properties.

news.title: UP-RERA disposes over 50,000 consumer complaints, leads in grievance redressal
news.para: UP-RERA has emerged as a frontrunner in resolving real estate disputes, addressing nearly 40% of the nation's grievances. The authority has resolved 50,812 consumer complaints out of 58,545 received, showcasing an impressive 85.2% disposal rate. This reflects UP-RERA's commitment to timely justice and promoter accountability, particularly in high-activity districts.

news.title: Planning hurdle as Madurai metro and NHAI proposals overlap in Thirumangalam
news.para: The Madurai Metro rail project faces a hurdle as its proposed route clashes with NHAI's plans for vehicular underpasses at accident-prone areas along the Thirumangalam stretch. This conflict arises at Sipcot and Thoppur intersections, requiring CMRL and NHAI to explore integrating infrastructure, potentially increasing pillar heights or shifting alignment. Discussions are planned to resolve the issue.

news.title: Green light for ₹136 crore city-side project at Thiruvananthapuram international airport
news.para: The Union environment ministry's expert panel has recommended environmental clearance for Adani Airport Holdings Ltd's (AAHL) proposed city-side development at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport. This Rs 136.31 crore project, featuring a 240-room hotel and commercial hub, is expected to receive formal EC within three months, paving the way for construction.

news.title: Jaipur civic body under fire over unsafe buildings
news.para: In Jaipur, a century-old building collapse claimed two lives and injured several others, sparking outrage among residents who blamed municipal negligence. Despite prior notices to the building owner, no action was taken, leading to the tragedy. While the corporation provides temporary shelter and aid, they deny formal compensation, intensifying efforts to identify and address unsafe structures across the city.

news.title: Dakshina Kannada records 777 illegal sand cases in three years
news.para: Dakshina Kannada faced many illegal sand mining cases. The Sand Committee reported 777 cases in three years. Authorities collected nearly Rupees 3 crore as penalties. Police registered 140 FIRs. The government awaits clearance for sand blocks in CRZs. MLC Ivan D'Souza highlighted government efforts. The district has a Mines Protection Force. Action on CRZ blocks awaits central government guidelines.

news.title: DDA invites bids for five-star hotel in Dwarka’s Sector 23
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is seeking a licensee for a five-star hotel in Dwarka's Sector 23, following the successful leasing of a site in Nehru Place. This 2.5-acre land parcel will be leased for 55 years, with the selected agency responsible for developing and managing a 200-room hotel.

news.title: DTCP demolishes illegal gates, guard room in Gurugram sector 85
news.para: Gurugram's Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) demolished illegal gates and a guard room erected by Orris Infrastructure in Sector 85, addressing resident complaints about restricted access on public roads. The DTCP also removed an encroachment by an RWA in Uppal Southend, Sector 49, where a road was illegally converted into a park.

news.title: YEIDA board gives nod for developed plots for farmers, urban centres in Hathras, Agra
news.para: YEIDA has approved several key proposals, including allotting developed plots to farmers and developing 29 smart villages with modern amenities. The authority will establish urban centers in Hathras and Agra to boost industrial and residential growth.

news.title: Bhubaneswar civic body partners with a bank for home loans to urban poor
news.para: To ease home loan access for affordable housing beneficiaries, the Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) has collaborated with a private bank. This partnership aims to assist urban poor beneficiaries in understanding banking norms and contributing their share for allotted houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) 2.0. A pilot project will involve 600 beneficiaries facing difficulties.

news.title: Punjab government cancels part of CLU granted to developer
news.para: The Punjab government has revoked a portion of the Change of Land Use permission granted to a developer for an industrial colony in Sector 102, Mohali, due to the submission of forged documents. This cancellation affects approximately 1.

news.title: About 29 smart villages in Noida off Yamuna Expressway next year?
news.para: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority is set to launch a Rs 350 crore smart village project by December 2026, upgrading 29 villages with modern infrastructure. Following a 2019 survey, the first phase focused on nine villages, allocating Rs 8–10 crore each, with work nearly completed.

news.title: Chandigarh: Manimajra housing project approval under the scanner
news.para: A controversy has erupted in Chandigarh over the approval of a multi-storey housing project in Manimajra. Senior officials allege that the agenda was illegally passed during a Municipal Corporation meeting. They claim opposition members were unjustly expelled, and a land disposal worth ₹800 crore lacked transparency, prompting calls for investigation and nullification of the decision.

news.title: REITs top ₹1.5 lakh crore m-cap; distributions up 13.7% in Q1 FY26 as investor base broadens
news.para: India's listed REITs have surpassed ₹1.5 lakh crore in market capitalization, distributing over ₹24,300 crore to unitholders since inception. Policy reforms are enhancing market accessibility, while the industry anticipates further measures to unlock passive flows. Despite global uncertainties, the sector remains optimistic, driven by GCCs and domestic enterprises, with a balanced supply-demand dynamic.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh RERA enables allottees to flag diversion of funds
news.para: UP-RERA has launched a portal feature allowing homebuyers to report promoters collecting payments outside designated project accounts, addressing fund diversion concerns. The authority will investigate complaints and take strict action against violators. Simultaneously, UP-RERA commenced its 19th real estate agent training program, emphasizing transparency and accurate information dissemination to buyers.
